metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16612 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
libXcursor before 1.1.15 has various integer overflows that could lead to heap buffer overflows when processing malicious cursors, e.g., with programs like GIMP. It is also possible that an attack vector exists against the related code in cursor/xcursor.c in Wayland through 1.14.0.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16612` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxcursor1 - 1:1.1.14-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

libwayland-bin - 1.12.0-1~ubuntu16.04.3
libwayland-client0 - 1.12.0-1~ubuntu16.04.3
libwayland-cursor0 - 1.12.0-1~ubuntu16.04.3
libwayland-server0 - 1.12.0-1~ubuntu16.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxcursor package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.1.14-1ubuntu0.16.04.1').
wayland package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.12.0-1~ubuntu16.04.3').
